page.title: 05DRY DRAYTON
page.content: Dry Drayton is a larger village than Lolworth but much smaller than Bar Hill.It is again an old established village but with some modern development,it too is a ribbon village,on the whole. There is a bridle way, from Dry Drayton to Bar Hill,called The Drift. When we visited Dry Drayton we interviewed some of the residents.We found that most of the villagers are worried about Bar Hill as they think that Bar Hill could expand so much that it will eventually swallow up Dry Drayton.Even if this doesn't happen they worry that their school will be closed and their children sent along The Drift to Bar Hill.They are also worried that thier Post Office will be closed. The Drift is only a grass track and Bar Hill is about half a mile along it.
